channel.title: Thepiratesbay.org?
channel.description: I've heard that you can download free stuff from here, is it safe?

item.title: Thepiratesbay.org?
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:16, topic:422600”][quote author=Ix Soulcist xI link=topic=525263.msg3824532#msg3824532 date=1322068202]
I’ve downloaded over a 100 torrents from that website and use Comcast, never had a problem before! The website is the most safest as far as I’ve been on it, not a problem at all with it.

Hint: Look for the most seeders, and attempt to not use torrents that have a lot of leeches. For the record, nothing should happen that is to be bad.
[/quote]
Stuff can happen, I’ve gotten letters from my ISP about illegal downloading.[/quote]
Yes, I know stuff can happen if the person downloads 30 torrents all the time.

Read full topic

item.title: Thepiratesbay.org?
item.dc:creator: @Mitko Mitko
item.description:
@Mitko wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:2, topic:422600”]and got a bill in the mail and a letter saying if I downloaded another pirated item I would be brought to court. Of course I have found ways around this. Basically, try it out once and wait around a week or so. You don’t want to torrent a ton and then find out your provider has been watching you the entire time.[/quote]Really? When my connection was slow, I called my ISP and after they “tweaked” it, they told me to download a movie from a bg tracker to test. I’m not kidding.

Read full topic

item.title: Thepiratesbay.org?
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

It’s only 100% safe if you use a VPN to hide your ip, because others (internet police) can see where it is streaming through when you are downloading stuff.

Read full topic

item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:8, topic:422600”]Loll slow guy

To start off its piratebay not piratesbay,
if it’s blocked in your country…like mine -.- use depiraatbaai dot org
You can download everything from tv shows to movies to games to programs on it,
it’s the biggest torrent site around.
To know it’s safe just look to the comments -.- if there’s a virus they will say
there are also skulls, green and pink skulls on an uploader wants to say it’s a trusted uploader,
what dosn’t mean others can’t be the skulled ones had to earn it to.
There are still tuns of other torrentsites,
private ones are the best but of course u need invites for that
anyways don’t forget to get a torrent downloader first,
and start off with dling bf3
:p[/quote]
i wanted
to read your
post
but it was too
hard to follow
such a weird flow of

characters.

item.title: Thepiratesbay.org?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

It uses a thing called p2p connectivity. Ever herd of torrents? tpb hosts those. You use a program such as utorrent to use these files to download said files. This is very risky if you don’t know what your doing. Some torrents are throttled by the police, or even your internet provider might monitor this protocal.

When I was in michigan I would torrent around 3-4GB of things daily. Now that I am in mississippi I tried a old movie from the 80’s and got a bill in the mail and a letter saying if I downloaded another pirated item I would be brought to court. Of course I have found ways around this. Basically, try it out once and wait around a week or so. You don’t want to torrent a ton and then find out your provider has been watching you the entire time.

Read full topic
